alert.note: Alert for Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:41AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Pottawattamie and southeastern Shelby Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1241 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Oakland, or 21 miles east of Council Bluffs, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oakland around 1250 AM CDT. Hancock around 1255 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Walnut. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 31 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
